intro: Withania coagulans, commonly known as the Indian cress or wild turnip, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other notable plants like tomatoes and potatoes. The plant is characterized by its small, white or yellowish flowers and oval, fleshy leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in open fields and along riverbanks. Withania coagulans is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional Ayurvedic practices.
